text: What's the point of this benchmark?

elements.text: What's the point of this benchmark?

text:
It converts everything to a `Vector{Float64}`, which is what he's measuring:
```julia> b = [1, 2.0]
2-element Array{Float64,1}:
 1.0
 2.0```
```julia> f() = for i in 1:100_000; b = [1, 2.0]; end
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> @btime f()
  169.059 ms (400000 allocations: 16.78 MiB)

julia> g() = for i in 1:100_000; b = [1.0, 2.0]; end
g (generic function with 1 method)

julia> @btime g()
  2.276 ms (100000 allocations: 9.16 MiB)

julia> h() = for i in 1:100_000; b = Union{Int,Float64}[1, 2.0]; end
h (generic function with 1 method)

julia> @btime h()
  3.173 ms (100000 allocations: 10.68 MiB)```

text: <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/blob/788b2c77c10c2160f4794a4d4b6b81a95a90940c/base/array.jl#L150>

Am I doing something wrong or is that no longer true?

```julia> function _vect(X...)
       T = Base.promote_typeof(X...)
       T[X[i] for i in eachindex(X)]
       end
_vect (generic function with 1 method)

julia> @btime _vect(1, 2.0)
  76.440 ns (4 allocations: 176 bytes)
2-element Array{Float64,1}:
 1.0
 2.0

julia> @btime Base.vect(1, 2.0)
  1.440 μs (4 allocations: 176 bytes)
2-element Array{Float64,1}:
 1.0
 2.0```

elements.text: Am I doing something wrong or is that no longer true?

julia> function _vect(X...)
       T = Base.promote_typeof(X...)
       T[X[i] for i in eachindex(X)]
       end
_vect (generic function with 1 method)

julia> @btime _vect(1, 2.0)
  76.440 ns (4 allocations: 176 bytes)
2-element Array{Float64,1}:
 1.0
 2.0

julia> @btime Base.vect(1, 2.0)
  1.440 μs (4 allocations: 176 bytes)
2-element Array{Float64,1}:
 1.0
 2.0

text:
With that def:

```julia> function Base.vect(X...)
       T = Base.promote_typeof(X...)
       T[X[i] for i in eachindex(X)]
       end

julia> f() = for i in 1:100_000; b = [1, 2.0]; end
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> @btime f()
  16.496 ms (200000 allocations: 10.68 MiB)```

elements.text: With that def:

julia> function Base.vect(X...)
       T = Base.promote_typeof(X...)
       T[X[i] for i in eachindex(X)]
       end

julia> f() = for i in 1:100_000; b = [1, 2.0]; end
f (generic function with 1 method)

julia> @btime f()
  16.496 ms (200000 allocations: 10.68 MiB)

Now I feel like the guy bitching about Wikipedia in 2004. <https://github.com/JuliaLang/julia/pull/39035>
